title: Canadian Pacific Railway Reports Record Revenue in 3Q
text:
By Stephen Nakrosis

Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd. (CP) said Wednesday revenue in the third-quarter rose to a record C$1.98 billion, while its operating margin fell to a record-low 56.1%.

The company said net income in the quarter was C$618 million, or C$4.46 per share. On an adjusted basis, the company reported EPS of C$4.61. Analysts were expecting earnings per share of C$4.50, and C$4.52 on a non-GAAP basis.

In the year-ago period, Canadian Pacific reported earnings per share of C$4.35, and adjusted EPS of C$4.12.

Keith Creel, president and chief executive of the company, said: "After a record second quarter that included strong operating metrics including train speed and terminal dwell, we continue to see those performance measures be improved upon."

--Write to Stephen Nakrosis at stephen.nakrosis@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 23, 2019 17:38 ET (21:38 GMT)
